title: Understanding SQL ORDER BY
text: The ORDER BY clause in SQL is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order. To sort in descending order, you use the DESC keyword.

title: SQL Syntax Reminder
text: Remember that SQL keywords are not case-sensitive, but it's a good practice to write them in uppercase for better readability.

hintAnswer: The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the Salary values.
title: Query Analysis
text: Consider the following queries: Query 1: SELECT Name, Salary FROM Employees. Query 2: SELECT Name, Salary FROM Employees ORDER BY Salary ASC. What is the difference in the result sets of these queries?
choices: The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the Salary values.
The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show Salary values that begin with the number $$5$$.
The query results for Query $$1$$ will show without any error message, while Query $$2$$ will show an error message.
